title: Professional website to sell Binance Gift Cards (USDT $500–$50,000) with Bitcoin payments

requirements.text: Create a responsive, professional marketing + storefront experience for selling Binance Gift Cards with fixed USDT denominations from $500 up to $50,000.

quotes: Janu mjhy 1 Website chahye Jaha Binance Gift Cards sell krny hain
Binance Gift Cards ki Value $500 sy le kr 50,000$ in uSDT ha

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage clearly states the product (Binance Gift Cards) and shows the available denomination range ($500–$50,000 USDT).
Storefront works well on mobile and desktop with consistent spacing, typography, and layout.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a product catalog UI that lets users browse and select a gift card denomination and quantity, and calculates totals in USDT.

quotes: Binance Gift Cards ki Value $500 sy le kr 50,000$ in uSDT ha

acceptanceCriteria: Users can select a denomination (within $500–$50,000 USDT) and quantity.
UI shows computed totals in USDT (denomination × quantity).
Selections persist through navigation to checkout (within the same session).

requirements.text: Implement a checkout flow that collects buyer contact details and presents Bitcoin payment instructions (Bitcoin payment acceptance) for the order.

quotes: or payment Bitcoin mai leni hai

acceptanceCriteria: Checkout collects at least: buyer name and an email (or other single contact field) and an optional note.
Checkout shows: amount due (in USDT), a Bitcoin payment address, and an order reference/ID to include with payment.
Order is created in the backend and can be retrieved by its ID from the frontend.
No third-party payment provider integration is required for checkout to function.

requirements.text: Create backend order storage and basic order status tracking (e.g., Pending Payment, Paid, Delivered, Cancelled) in the single Motoko main actor.

quotes: or payment Bitcoin mai leni hai

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to: create an order, fetch an order by ID, and list orders (for basic administration).
Each order stores: denomination (USDT), quantity, total (USDT), buyer contact, status, and timestamps.
Default status on creation is Pending Payment.

requirements.text: Add a minimal admin screen (no external auth required) to review orders and update order status manually (e.g., mark as Paid/Delivered) after verifying Bitcoin payment off-app.

quotes: or payment Bitcoin mai leni hai

acceptanceCriteria: Admin screen lists recent orders with key fields (order ID, total USDT, status, created time).
Admin can open an order detail view and change status.
Status changes persist and are visible to the buyer when they view the order by ID.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a professional crypto storefront (avoid blue/purple), including consistent color palette, typography, button styles, and section layouts.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is applied consistently across homepage, catalog, checkout, and admin pages.
Primary colors are not blue/purple unless explicitly requested later.
UI uses Tailwind + existing UI components via composition (no edits to immutable UI component sources).

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Homepage and/or header uses the logo and hero image.
Catalog uses the product illustration asset in a visually consistent way.

constraints: Use a single Motoko actor for all backend logic (no additional backend services).
Do not modify any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose them instead.
Do not implement third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity is the only supported auth option if authentication is later needed.
Do not implement automatic on-chain Bitcoin payment verification; payment confirmation must be manual unless the user later requests and constraints allow.
nonGoals: Full e-commerce features like discount codes, shipping, returns, or customer accounts (unless requested later).
Automatic Bitcoin exchange-rate conversion between USDT and BTC.
Integration with Binance APIs or gift card inventory automation.
Real-time payment detection, WebSockets, or push notifications.

required: Wide hero banner with abstract fintech shapes and warm dark theme (hero-giftcards.dim_1600x600.png)
Simple gift card product illustration, clean vector style (product-giftcard-illustration.dim_800x800.png)

preferencesToAdd: Use English for all user-facing text in the app.
